data.name: TableBorder2
desc: contains the style settings of the border lines of all cells in a cell range.
TableBorder2 is nearly identical to TableBorder, except that it has members of BorderLine2 instead of BorderLine.
In a queried structure, the flags in TableBorder2.Is...LineValid indicate that not all lines of the boxes have the same values.
In a structure which is used for setting, these flags determine if the corresponding line should be set or if the old value should be kept.
**since**
LibreOffice 3.6

properties.name: TopLine
desc: determines the line style at the top edge.

properties.name: IsTopLineValid
desc: specifies whether the value of TableBorder2.TopLine is used.

properties.name: BottomLine
desc: determines the line style at the bottom edge.

properties.name: IsBottomLineValid
desc: specifies whether the value of TableBorder2.BottomLine is used.

properties.name: LeftLine
desc: determines the line style at the left edge.

properties.name: IsLeftLineValid
desc: specifies whether the value of TableBorder2.LeftLine is used.

properties.name: RightLine
desc: determines the line style at the right edge.

properties.name: IsRightLineValid
desc: specifies whether the value of TableBorder2.RightLine is used.

properties.name: HorizontalLine
desc: determines the line style of horizontal lines for the inner part of a cell range.

properties.name: IsHorizontalLineValid
desc: specifies whether the value of TableBorder2.HorizontalLine is used.

properties.name: VerticalLine
desc: determines the line style of vertical lines for the inner part of a cell range.

properties.name: IsVerticalLineValid
desc: specifies whether the value of TableBorder2.VerticalLine is used.

properties.name: Distance
desc: contains the distance between the lines and other contents.

properties.name: IsDistanceValid
desc: specifies whether the value of TableBorder2.Distance is used.
